intro: Gnaphalium sylvaticum var. rectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cudweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in compact clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a soft, woolly texture on the upper surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
